snippet.textDisplay: For the amount of money they took from those of us paying through the nose during the 80s and 90s, when they were virtually a monopoly, they could have invested the cash and run the business off the interest, so by now, it should be free. At least now there is competition (although Apple seems to be the new Microsoft with flakey software releases, and Win10 actually seeming to be quite robust for once). If they didnt keep changing things, not improving just changing, then half the point of the upgrade would be redundant, and we might not have to keep re-learning how to do things that were once simple.
snippet.textOriginal: For the amount of money they took from those of us paying through the nose during the 80s and 90s, when they were virtually a monopoly, they could have invested the cash and run the business off the interest, so by now, it should be free. At least now there is competition (although Apple seems to be the new Microsoft with flakey software releases, and Win10 actually seeming to be quite robust for once). If they didnt keep changing things, not improving just changing, then half the point of the upgrade would be redundant, and we might not have to keep re-learning how to do things that were once simple.

snippet.textDisplay: Business speaking giving W10 away for free opens a lot more users up to making money off them. people seem to forget that W10 is still a massive spybot that phones all kinds of shit home to MS, and not a lot of users are knowledgeable enough to turn that off. Hence, Data sales. Meta data. How many times you click, where you click, where on the screen your attention is (So it can move adds to that range if possible), ect. I find it funny how people think the meta data is useless and it cant be used, even though its probably one of the largest money makers today outside of war, oil, and a combination of the two. They do not always sell this data to people with the best intentions to... IE Cambridge Analytic-a). Privacy vs Seurity vs Making Profit.
snippet.textOriginal: Business speaking giving W10 away for free opens a lot more users up to making money off them. people seem to forget that W10 is still a massive spybot that phones all kinds of shit home to MS, and not a lot of users are knowledgeable enough to turn that off. Hence, Data sales. Meta data. How many times you click, where you click, where on the screen your attention is (So it can move adds to that range if possible), ect. I find it funny how people think the meta data is useless and it cant be used, even though its probably one of the largest money makers today outside of war, oil, and a combination of the two. They do not always sell this data to people with the best intentions to... IE Cambridge Analytic-a). Privacy vs Seurity vs Making Profit.

snippet.textDisplay: Windows isn't free now. You can install it for free, but you could do that before using a friends copy. You still need a product key in order to change settings or anything, so you can only do basic stuff without the product key. The product key costs money and gives you full functionality, the product key is not free and therefore neither is the operating system.
snippet.textOriginal: Windows isn't free now. You can install it for free, but you could do that before using a friends copy. You still need a product key in order to change settings or anything, so you can only do basic stuff without the product key. The product key costs money and gives you full functionality, the product key is not free and therefore neither is the operating system.

snippet.textDisplay:
1. Go to https://get.msguides.com/windows10.txt
2. Copy the given text.
3. Open "Notepad" and paste the text in to the "Notepad"
4. When saving the file, from the dropdown box select "All files" and name your file "whatever.bat"
5. Run the ".bat" file that you've just made.
6. Enjoy no "Activate Windows" watermark, and feel free to customize your Windows 10!
snippet.textOriginal:
1. Go to https://get.msguides.com/windows10.txt
2. Copy the given text.
3. Open "Notepad" and paste the text in to the "Notepad"
4. When saving  the file, from the dropdown box select "All files" and name your file "whatever.bat"
5. Run the ".bat" file that you've just made.
6. Enjoy no "Activate Windows" watermark, and feel free to customize your Windows 10!

snippet.textDisplay:
The video is misleading.
"Free" and "Free of charge"/"at no cost" in the software are two different things. Windows is not "free" at all even if MS would stop using a watermark. "Free software" is something completely different. I hope people (especially in techy channels) would realize it.
snippet.textOriginal:
The video is misleading.
"Free" and "Free of charge"/"at no cost" in the software are two different things. Windows is not "free" at all even if MS would stop using a watermark. "Free software" is something completely different. I hope people (especially in techy channels) would realize it.

snippet.textDisplay: I upgraded from win7 to win10 just before christmas. There is a huge bug with it that produced a 100% continuous read/write error where the hard drive runs continuously at maximum speed even when it should be idle... you notice the performance hit first and after a couple hours searching for a fix you are advised to update windows... it only fixes it partially as now at least when idle its not maxing out but when working tge drive is always peaking at 100% after a day of working with it... and several very fast restarts as win10 boots way faster than win7... my drive gave out... impossible to recover... now i need a hard drive and a fresh purchased OS of a total value $300- $400 total for both items to restore my machine. Its a complete loss as even though the rest of my hardware is in good condition, its a nearly 8 year old machine not worth $400. Win10 totalled my pc.(edit: for autocorrect ninjas)
snippet.textOriginal: I upgraded from win7 to win10 just before christmas. There is a huge bug with it that produced a 100% continuous read/write error where the hard drive runs continuously at maximum speed even when it should be idle... you notice the performance hit first and after a couple hours searching for a fix you are advised to update windows... it only fixes it partially as now at least when idle its not maxing out but when working tge drive is always peaking at 100% after a day of working with it... and several very fast restarts as win10 boots way faster than win7... my drive gave out... impossible to recover... now i need a hard drive and a fresh purchased OS of a total value $300- $400 total for both items to restore my machine. snippet.textDisplay: SO glad I use Linux as my main OS and don't have to succumb to being wallet milked by shady corporate business tactics. Before anyone says "but performance, gaming, etc"...I get about a 10-15% INCREASE on Linux vs. Windows....and yes, even running Windows games on it. Linux is getting a LOT more developer support in all areas and it's far superior imho. If your experience with Linux hasn't been the same, try a rolling release distro like Arch or Manjaro for the latest updates. Take the time to learn and configure, it's beyond worth it to break free from Microsoft. Windows 10 really is nothing more than an elaborate phone app when you think about it. It's a one trick pony and I sure wouldn't trust ANY of my data or information to it. 😂😂
snippet.textOriginal: SO glad I use Linux as my main OS and don't have to succumb to being wallet milked by shady corporate business tactics. Before anyone says "but performance, gaming, etc"...I get about a 10-15% INCREASE on Linux vs. Windows....and yes, even running Windows games on it. Linux is getting a LOT more developer support in all areas and it's far superior imho. If your experience with Linux hasn't been the same, try a rolling release distro like Arch or Manjaro for the latest updates. Take the time to learn and configure, it's beyond worth it to break free from Microsoft. Windows 10 really is nothing more than an elaborate phone app when you think about it. It's a one trick pony and I sure wouldn't trust ANY of my data or information to it. 😂😂

snippet.textDisplay:
You conveniently omitted importand MS WIndows information about "free" use, and that is
Once you installed for "free" license or logged in to Windows with Microsoft account,
Microsoft is logging all your searches, traffic, application installs and use and EVERYTHING you type on your keyboard, ends up on Microsoft servers, including unwillingly ALL of your DATA "backed up" (stopen) to Microsoft servers, too, without asking, the minute you log into windows with "Microsoft account".
